instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 3787 No KB backlight
threads.message: Everything else works. LCD backlight responds to light/dark on webcam so ALS is working. I have 5V both sides of <DIODE>D7720</DIODE> / L7220. 5V at J4915. Tested FB lines for continuity back to resistors near <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. Those resistors are zero ohms. <RESISTOR>R7747</RESISTOR> measures ok. Tried forcing 3V to <CAPACITOR>C7747</CAPACITOR> with <RESISTOR>R7747</RESISTOR> removed. Replaced <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. tested with new kb Backlight and 2 other used ones. Nothing. I'm lost.

threads.title: 3787 No KB backlight
threads.message:
"Tried forcing 3V to <CAPACITOR>C7747</CAPACITOR> with <RESISTOR>R7747</RESISTOR> removed."
Still 5V output then?

Be sure <RESISTOR>R7741</RESISTOR> is good and change L7720.

threads.title: 3787 No KB backlight
threads.message: YEs still 5V. <RESISTOR>R7741</RESISTOR> is reading good. Changed L7720. Still no kb backlight with jumper or with <RESISTOR>R7747</RESISTOR> back in place and jumper removed.

threads.title: 3787 No KB backlight
threads.message: Just tried that. No change. I checked diode readings on J4915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> also. I really don't understand what is preventing the KB backlight from working... Where does the ALS actually control the KB backlight at? I'm thinking the issue must be where those two things tie together?

threads.title: 3787 No KB backlight
threads.message:
ALS reaction comes through SCL/SDA lines to <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>.
The information arrive to <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, if it adjust LCD backlight.

Check all solders and traces related with keyboard backlight.
Still 5V output disconnecting webcam?

BTW, I hope you've measured all with keyboard backlight connected.

threads.title: 3787 No KB backlight
threads.message: Not understanding why the hell this kB backlight won't come on. tested connections. from J4915 to <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and components in between. replaced all of the Caps <CAPACITOR>C7723</CAPACITOR>/4/5/6/7. Is there a good way to just have the kB backlight stay on? I guess I could try replacing <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> again... I'm at a loss as to what could possibly still be wrong.

threads.title: 3787 No KB backlight
threads.message: Just in case, test with another compatible screen.

threads.title: 3787 No KB backlight
threads.message: Yes. This actually had two issues when I received it, Cracked LCD and no KB backlight so the problem has persisted after swapping to another screen

threads.title: 3787 No KB backlight
threads.message: Connect original webcam and see what happens.

threads.title: 3787 No KB backlight
threads.message: I'm wondering if whatever issue this has/had could be breaking the KB backlights I"m testing? Just wondering if the amperage couldve been high at some point. I connected an LED after wondering this and I do see life in that but it comes on just briefly and then goes out til I reconnect it.

threads.title: 3787 No KB backlight
threads.message:
Backlight keyboard has more than 1 LED.
Check voltage on good machine, to aproximate LEDs number.
